asset.name: ARO-ALK7
asset.one_liner: Receptor-targeting approach to the activin E obesity pathway - orthogonal to ARO-INHBE

target.name: ALK7
target.pathway: Activin E / ALK7 signaling in adipose tissue

biology.simple_explanation: ALK7 is the receptor for activin E in adipose tissue. While ARO-INHBE targets the ligand (activin E), ARO-ALK7 targets the receptor directly. Both approaches should block the same fat-storage pathway.
biology.pathway_detail: ALK7 (ACVR1C) is expressed in adipocytes and binds activin E to promote lipid storage. Silencing ALK7 should block activin E signaling regardless of ligand levels.
downstream_effects: Blocked activin E signaling at receptor level
Potential weight loss similar to ARO-INHBE

why_good_target.rationale: Orthogonal approach to same validated pathway as ARO-INHBE

mechanism.how_it_works: ARO-ALK7 silences ALK7 (ACVR1C) mRNA in adipose tissue, preventing activin E from signaling through its receptor. This blocks fat accumulation and promotes weight loss through the same pathway as ARO-INHBE.

lead.name: Obesity
lead.rationale: Alternative approach if ARO-INHBE limited by ligand biology

bull_case.point: Orthogonal approach to same validated pathway
bull_case.evidence: ALK7 is receptor for INHBE/activin E

bull_case.point: Earlier stage means less dilution if successful

bear_case.counter_argument: Different tissue targeting may yield different profile

key_debates.question: Will ALK7 inhibition show differentiated profile vs ARO-INHBE?
key_debates.bull_view: Receptor targeting in adipose may have different efficacy/safety
key_debates.bear_view: Same pathway means similar results; one program sufficient

catalysts.what_to_watch: Weight loss, comparison to ARO-INHBE profile
